results.title: The Professor
results.brief_description: A Special Mention in the Middle Live Action category. Set in the 1900’s, there has been a series of unsolved murders. Two professors have been put on the case. Unfortunately for one he doesn’t know who his partner is until it’s too late.

results.title: A Wilted Flower
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Live Action category. In a student-made, psychological and mental-health themed short film, a girl, followed by the dark side and thoughts of herself must overcome a presence in her life, or fail and succumb to it. A dark cloud can wilt any flower, but can this flower find the light again?

results.title: The Shackles You Cannot See
results.creator_credit: Robyn Fairbairn and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Senior Live Action category. The premise of The Shackles You Cannot See is to explore the blurred lines between Fate vs. Free Will in the Modern World. As a futuristic dystopian narrative, it stands as a warning of the consequences of technological advances, to make people question their actions in their daily life, as well as question their rights to psychological and physical freedom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robyn Fairbairn and St Mary’s Anglican Girls’ College

results.title: The Black Hood Strikes
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Animation category. Priceless jewels were stolen from a rich family during their fancy ball. It’s the BLACK HOOD!’ Only the local private investigator can get to the bottom of this terrible crime and find the Black Hood before he flees the country and it’s too late. Will he stop him, will he survive, will he run out of fuel and who is the BLACK HOOD? So many questions, it’s a mystery.

results.title: Amazing Mums
results.brief_description: A Winner in the Junior Live Action category of Screen It 2016. Have you ever wondered how your mum fits so much into a day? Well so has Sarah! Join her as she tries to figure out the mystery that is her mums schedule and how she could possibly fit so much into one day… she might just find out more than she bargained for!

results.title: Day One [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Videogame. In 2017, tens of thousands of Australians will battle the greatest mystery of their lives … high school. In ‘Day One’, your mission is to survive your first day of high school. You will need to find your seat in assembly, learn a new instrument, escape detention, sprint 100 metres, destroy a vending machine, and dodge rubbish bins to ultimately find your classroom.

results.title: 100 Pages
results.brief_description: ‘100 Pages’ is a project based upon the theme of North Sydney Girls High School’s Centenary. This project used the School’s identity and history as inspiration for artmaking. Through the artmaking, students are celebrating the school’s identity in the present and past community; isolating individual events, subjects and objects as inspiration. The title of the unit, ‘100 Pages’, comes from the initial idea of 100 animations, for 100 years of history. This project has been developed for the Stage 5 elective, Year 10 Photography and Digital Media class (PDM), which comprises 12 students from North Sydney Girls High School.

results.title: The Devoted Friend
results.brief_description: This open ended Oscar Wilde tale challenges us to consider whether a bully is aware that they are a bully. It questions whether you can expect a bully to reform by asking them to reflect on their actions. The story shifts focus from the question “what is a bully?” to “what is a true friend?”.
